enhanced_by.reason: Both methods interact with the same set of PTCP options, making them closely related in terms of state management.
The initialization of the socket and its associated options is a prerequisite for accessing or modifying PTCP options.
The connection state of the socket must be established before accessing PTCP options, as some options may be dependent on the connection state.
The TCP open event indicates that the socket is ready for data transfer, which may include accessing PTCP options.
